website_summaries.verdict: Made of clog-resistant vinyl for consistent water delivery whether above ground or buried below.
pros: Made of environmentally friendly recycled vinyl
Delivers plenty of water with its clog-resistant design
Hose and connectors are made of good-quality materials
cons: Price is a little high per linear foot for a flat soaker hose

customer_reviews.title: I been soaked!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hose in May of this year. Here it is July and already we're having problems with it!! Water is spraying freely out of the first 3 ft of the hose and the last 3 ft of the hose. In between, not enough to keep the weed alive!! 7 year warranty??? Why do I think that's probably a crock too? We'll see. Am contacting the company on their "webpage" as there is no link to communicate with them on Amazon. If anyone has ever found a soaker hose that actually lasts for more than 2 or 3 months ... please let me know! It's a great concept.
customer_reviews.author: S. Laymon

customer_reviews.title: Leaked from connector immediately
customer_reviews.text: I installed and put mulch over hose. Connect it and turned water on. Very first time used, it leaked (sprayed) from connector. I took coupling (blue piece) apart and reconnected -- still leaks. It is leaking from the hose connector. I returned it and received a replacement. It is light weight and easy to handle. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: A Hose By any Other Name...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these to replace long standing hoses that melted away in the Texas Sun. A month in and they seem to be doing OK. the trick here is to only use enough pressure at the nozzle to show a decent drip at the end, not crank it and hope for the best. I expect to get a couple years out of these, which more than covers the cost going in
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Leaks from right out of the package...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these hoses. They seemed better than the old rubber types, stronger, and more even watering. But from the get go I had tiny water spouts coming out. I waited to install until I had tie which now means the window of return has closed. When you put them in don't run them tight curves they can't handle it. Instead do figure 8s and overlap every one or alternate your rows. So if you have 12" rows run the hose in 24" rows and then come back through your rows on the missed 24" rows. Would I buy again? Not at this price.
customer_reviews.author: hbh

customer_reviews.title: Another problem with 50 footer
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Gilmour hoses in the past but this year, this is my second 50 footer hose that has had a problem. I will be contacting Gilmour since there is a warranty. First use and there was a hole in this one too. The 25 footers haven't had a problem, but the 50 footers..... Grrrrrr. Such an inconvenience to get the hoses dried out and sent back and go through all the time and paperwork. I do not suggest buying the 50 footers Gilmour brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tereerose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to store, more durable than you'd think.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for three years (some are finishing the 3rd season of use with no sign of degrading or breaking.) I have a farm and need to water my rare & heirloom variety plants during dry weather. I'm also a disabled veteran with intermittent problems walking and holding things. These are lightweight enough for me to handle on my bad days. I frequently roll over them with a wheelbarrow or a riding lawn mower without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: First time use the first six feet are spewing water. The rest of the hose isn’t working because of this. There are no kinks so no reason except for bad sewing on the hose. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Olson

customer_reviews.title: Worked where others failed
customer_reviews.text: I started a hay bale garden and needed a 50 foot soaker hose. This one is far superior to the two 25 foot piece of crap soakers I got from Lowes. It was inexpensive, one continuous hose that keeps consistent pressure throughout the entire length of the leg be. Hard to argue with over 800+ four star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: sandy hampton

customer_reviews.title: Leaks so bad it cannot be used!
customer_reviews.text: I have Used many soaker hoses. This one looks great and collapses to a flat easy to handle shape to put it away. But i really Don’t like how the water flows through it. Even when i lower the hose to a quarter turn water is not restricted enough. I did Not ask to return it and I am still trying to make it work. UPDATE, after only a couple of weeks this leaks so much through the side that is sewn that it is unusable an they won't take returns.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Cannistraci

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on replacing all of the soaker hoses in my gardens this year. After reading a number of reviews online that ranked the Gilmore hoses one of the best, I bought 25', 50' and 75' hoses. I've installed 5 of them thus far. All have uneven distribution of water, and I thought I could live with small flooded areas of the gardens. But, after installing the 75' hose in a new garden bed and having a flood in the first 10 feet, I give up. Guess I will be returning the unused hoses and requesting my money back on the 75' hose. Perhaps I shouldn't depend on the "professional" reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to water my desert trees this week and they worked beautifully. Lightweight and easy to cart around our large yard. They worked very well even with a low water flow -had an even trickle all along the hose. The screwed onto my garden hose without a leak. I can’t speak for the durability yet, as they’re brand new (this form required a star rating in that category so I put what they look like new). I hope to be able to leave them out in the hot Arizona sun so I can water the trees regularly so will see!
customer_reviews.author: Neecey

customer_reviews.title: I recommend without any hesitation
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY what I was looking for to water my tomatoes and basil. It’s just the amount of water I expect from a soaker hose. No sprays, just good dripping. But enough dripping to be efficient and thoroughly water my bed within 10-15 mins. I’ve only had it for a couple of weeks, but so far so good. One warning... the holes run literally from end to end. So if it needs to cross an area before reaching your bed, get a cheap hose just long enough to allow the soaker to start in the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: so easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: As most gardeners know it is important to water deeply. Standing with a hose doesn't cut it. Water is wasted and the person gets eaten up with bugs. Enter the weeper hose. No waste and deep waterings so roots will go deep instead of to surface. I water once or twice a week when necessary and have no problem with fungus or on tomatoes the bottom blossom rot. That is from too many shallow waterings that drain the nutrients out of thee soil. Fold up in fall and ready for next year.
customer_reviews.author: de by

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and every single one had multiple large leaks after two weeks. Any place where I had to bend the hose even slightly it developed a hole big enough that the hose beyond the hole stopped working. Two of the hoses were laid straight and still developed large holes. Must be a design flaw or defect in manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Soaker Hose
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING LEAKS EVERYWHERE... oh wait, that's what it is supposed to do! I really like this hose because it lays flat under the mulch when it is not in use, a lot easier to lay and move around the garden too.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Fella

customer_reviews.title: Complete crap!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple of Amazon and a few more at a local store. All have failed! On one end or the other, they have split and turned into a sprinkler. On my system I have set the pressure to 20psi with the aid of a regulator and 2 gagues. Only purchase of you need one for about a month. Then throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Cee P

customer_reviews.title: Like a soaker hose and a sprinkler all in one ...In a bad way.
customer_reviews.text: Proper soaking most places but it leaks streams of water at several places at the seams. I will avoid flat soaker hoses in the future. I will stick with the round hoses that don't have seams. I have bought several and never had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, Lake Orion, Mi

customer_reviews.title: Super Soaker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two 50 foot and one 25 foot hoses. When I picked up the box, I thought surely all three were not there. There were and they are perfect. I use them in three separate flower beds and they do an amazing job. They were easy to lay out with no kinking and are easy to attach to the water hose. They are exactly what this petite 75 year old needs to keep her flower garden watered. So glad I did not fall for the poor reviews.
customer_reviews.author: GulfCoastNon

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to deal with
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is a good idea - compact and lightweight - but it doesn't work for me. It crimps too easily and is not easy to move around, especially among dense plantings. It snags on everything. I will go back to the old fashioned kind.
customer_reviews.author: Hanny Panny

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Well....great concept. But the 3 I tried to use out of the 10 I bought blew apart. I have decent water pressure. But it doesnt exceed 70psi. It was enough to blow these apart after 1 or 2 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Z Knisley

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this soaker hose. I have had it for about 2 weeks now. Shipping was fast. I have the 75ft hose. It runs though all my flower beds. Its soaks pretty evenly and it's lightweight. The cap on the end can unscrew if you need it too which is helpful if i need to use it as a hose for just a moment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: It waters all the plants by the side of my house. Really like it. The only one I've ever purchased. Works well! Ty
customer_reviews.author: Linda Butler

customer_reviews.title: Leaked like CRAZY
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted to like this product. I have a raised garden with a diy greenhouse top. I wanted a way to water the garden without having to open the greenhouse. However, my dreams were quickly dashed at how badly it leaked at the hose connection. It was spewing out so bad I was able to collect 2 watering cans full before I turned it off and called it quits. I wouldn't have minded a little leak but it was wasting too much water.
customer_reviews.author: M. Major

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased at first with these hoses. Easy to place, etc. But they sprung leaks after only one year, and they were garaged over the winter. Unfortunately having to replace all three, and that is disappointing for the money I had to spend. There is no reason they should fail after one year, with a very slow water pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Major6th

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought the hose mid-April, but using it regularly it is already only watering along the first quarter of the line two months later. I cannot find a way to contact the seller to give them a chance to make it right. Until something changes, 1 Star.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Collins

customer_reviews.title: This Soaker Hose has been RELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: I first had bought a Flexon soaker hose 2-pack from Costco (NOT to be confused with Gilmour's "flexogen" line. Those are good). I had a horrible experience with the Flexon soaker hoses. Both hoses immediately sprung bigger "leaks" than I wanted, and during my first use one of the hoses BURSTED. I returned the Flexon hoses to Costco asap. I then ordered this Gilmour soaker has from amazon. I have very happy with it. It has worked great for the 3 months I've owned. it. It's pretty easy to "lay out" and "fold back up" and is getting easier the more I work with it. If anything changes in this hose's performance, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: W. Haltom

customer_reviews.title: I love this hose!
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I have used the conventional soaker hoses, and they are so stiff, they are hard to manage. This hose is simple - you lay it out however you like, and it stays exactly where you put it. It's light as a feather and easy to carry, lay out, and move around. I first bought the 75' hose for my vegetable garden, and loved it so much I bought a 50' one to add to it so that I could run it down my property line and plant ground cover. Everything I have planted is doing great - nothing has died - because this hose is so easy to manage and move.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Nice but leaks a little around plastic fittings
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my needs. I did notice it leaks a little around the plastic ends, but overall that doesn't matter much. I use a leader hose to get me to where I want the water to start anyway. Also, to save watering between shrubs (since I have about 5' between shrubs) I bought a few lengths of 1-1/2" PVC pipe and ran the soaker hose through that. That way the water from the section of hose between shrubs is diverted back to the shrub at each end and not wasted inbetween where there is nothing growing.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Soaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to try on my foundation as we are in drought. It works so well, I immediately bought a second one. I placed them going opposite directions to go completely around (almost). Within two days running several hours. I could lock and unlock my backdoor again. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soaker
customer_reviews.text: I love this soaker as I have used the rubber leak soaker for years and have found them to last only a short time as they are very prone to developing holes. This soaker is very efficient in its distribution of water, it is more even in its distribution. The first couple of days I used this soaker I ran it for the length of time with the other soakers and used way more water than I intended.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Belknap

customer_reviews.title: Send me a hose that works and I paid my money for
customer_reviews.text: I have made several attempts at getting this hose rolled out, making sure itt is laid flat in my flowerbed and still there are sections of the hose that either release little o no water at all. This has been frustrating, time consuming s, and disappointing. Creating a flowerbed with nice curb appeal with hopes of keeping my shrubs, plants, and flowers regularly watered with the help of a soaker hose has now been a let down because of a non functioning hose.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Soaker hose requires additional purchase to prevent flooding.
customer_reviews.text: Soaker hose CAN’T be used AS MADE! Water starts flowing too close to the spigot, runs down the hose and floods the immediate area. Then you have to walk in the muk to turn the hose off. We’ll fix the problem by inserting a section of regular hose between the faucet and the soaker hose (something else to buy, make, or jury/rig). My opinion: If you’re going to make a product don’t do it half-assed - Make it right so it works right!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This soaker worked pretty well when I first got it but near the beginning of its second season the inner hose split rendering the soaker useless. Based on one of the other reviews here I found that I could remove the inlet end fitting, cut the hose off just beyond where it was split and reassemble it. The repair process seems to have worked. We will see next spring. Another reviewer suggests drilling a small hole in a penny to use as a flow restrictor. That seems like a good enough idea that Gilmour should incorporate that into the original manufacture. It would be better for them than enduring all of the negative comments and losing sales.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to Weep About Here
customer_reviews.text: This weeper/soaker hose offers a great band for your buck. My grandmother needed something to help out around her house with summer watering. Not being quite as active/mobile as she one was, she wanted something that she could leave running and not worry about moving frequently. I ordered her this, and she loves it. It's made watering a cinch! She simply leaves it plugged in all summer. It's hidden around her flower beds and the house, and she can just kick on the faucet by her door whenever things need a drink after some dry days or weeks. This is a no-brainer. The 50-ft length, good quality build, and sub-$20 price tag make it a real deal!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T. Ebert

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Fathers Soaker Hose
customer_reviews.text: This is a great soaker hose. I use it in conjunction with a Melnor Battery Operated Timer for my blueberry bushes. Just don’t bend the hose to much or it will kink and starve water to the end of the hose. Great buy. I’m purchasing more now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Meh! I prefer rounder, rubberized soaker hoses
customer_reviews.text: This was certainly inexpensive and easy to order, esp. since I needed to replace a soaker hose somewhat out of season. But it's not the greatest quality. It's made out of a cloth-like fabric and flat, so it kinks up pretty easily, esp. if you want to create a loop around a larger plant to get more water to it. Water drips out along a narrow line of tiny holes, rather than outside of the entire circumference of around hose. That's a problem if you aren't directing the water correctly when you lay down the hose. So I'm glad I have this product in a pinch, but I won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Timohuatl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Nice soaker hose. There are a few dry spots running along the hose so I can't give this item 5 stars. Other than that, I am quite pleased with this item. UPDATE: Now that I am at the end of the growing season, I'm finding that the soaker hose really isn't meeting my needs anymore. It now only soaks in some areas of the hose, not all. I'm not sure if it got to hot or what but I'll probably end up replacing it next year. I'm downgrading my review from 4 to 2 stars for this reason. If anyone has found something better, I'd appreciate knowing what you bought.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: returned without trying it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a water well and was afraid it would keep my water pump on too much.
customer_reviews.author: jill

customer_reviews.title: 4 years old
customer_reviews.text: Needed to order a new one because I damaged one of my 3 with a garden tool. I see that mine are 4 years old, have been out all year 'round in the hot Phoenix sun and no problem 'til I caused one. I just hope my new one lasts as long. The price has gone up quite a bit, though.
customer_reviews.author: Littlebird

customer_reviews.title: Best soaker hose I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best soaker hose I’ve ever used. Works best when laid out in a straight line. Weaving around plants creates pinch points where the hose will weep a bit more, but still supplies even water distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysun

customer_reviews.title: Awesome soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: As many people have stated in their reviews, this soaker hose is great. It's extremely sturdy, does not kink, and can be laid out in seconds. I started a pretty large garden on the side of my house and needed a 50 ft soaker hose as watering each plant one by one was just getting too tedious. This hose works best under minimal water pressure. I turn it on and leave it for 2-3 hours while I get to work doing other things. Also, this hose can attach to other hoses or even a water barrel if you make one. The opposite end is capped but can be unscrewed to become another connector end. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brahmology, LLC

customer_reviews.title: It work just for 15 days. Using 15 min daily.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with my order. I ordered 2 more but after 15-20 days start it making a mess, from dripping nicely to bunch of water every where. I hope it will work good for you, I still will try the other 2, maybe they will work ok, but if doesnt I will return it and look for another brand..
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Galvez

customer_reviews.title: My mom likes it, she bought another one
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my mom, she likes it enough that she bought another one herself but I will say they screws on the plastic ends seem to have gotten rusty very quickly, I guess we’ll see how they hold up
customer_reviews.author: Ava S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad...cheap not worth even sending back...
customer_reviews.text: Very very thin hoses. I have bought 4 & 3 already leak. They are constantly kinking
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Connectors were cracked upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Order two (2) 50' hoses and one (1) 75' hose. Both of the 50' hoses arrived with the connectors cracked. They were not damaged during shipment, but appear to have a manufacturing/quality control flaw. Attempts to use them as-is were fruitless as there was excessive leakage and spraying from the connectors. The 75' hose did not have any defects and worked correctly.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Requires monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these hoses this year, all lengths. I like them, but agree they have durability issues. I use duck tape and place the breaks in helpful spots, but that won't work for everyone. I like the product and set-up I have going, but this is not a set it and forget it product that will work for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: LorrieAnne

customer_reviews.title: Wrong choice
customer_reviews.text: I like the length of this hose but you have to turn your hydrant up to it's full potential just to get water all the way through it. It kinks and prevents utilization of full hose without running your water bill sky high.
customer_reviews.author: MsPeaches

customer_reviews.title: Crap-Ola
customer_reviews.text: Very inconsistent watering along the length of the hose. I have large puddles of water in some spots and almost dry in other spots.
customer_reviews.author: Zog

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS HOSE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this hose!!! Again do not buy this hose. Unless you want 3’ of your garden watered. Even if you run it straight the water only bubbles out slowly to the point where you would die of dehydration. This is a terrible design and product. DO NOT BUY THIS HOSE. I GIVE THIS ZERO STATS AND 2 thumbs down!!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt rapp

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the older hard black rubber soaker hoses. These are just so much easier to lay out. They don't puncture as easily also. And much easier to store. As my old hoses wear out, I'm replacing them with these flat hoses. They round out as soon as you turn on the water. I want to add one caveat about this product. I managed to cut this hose and it is more difficult to repair than the old rubber hoses.
customer_reviews.author: gusgus

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, but these don't work. Bought three, two 25' and a 50'. Problem is only the first ten feet or so (of either length) actually let water through. After that I guess water pressure isn't enough to force the water through the hose. These are flexible and don't kink, they appear to be canvas like and fold nearly flat. But my garden had next to no water in it even after several hours at full pressure. There were small "puddles" of water intermittently along the length of the hose but not enough to allow me to say the garden has been watered. I like the non-flexible soaker hoses better.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy N

customer_reviews.title: really great soaker
customer_reviews.text: these soakers are much better than the old round kind. the old round soakers were too slow I would have to leave them on all night. these water a large area in a couple of hours. I don't like overhead watering in my garden as overhead watering beats the plants too much. also overhead deposits what ever mineral is in you water. we have our own well with a lot of iron. i was looking for a way to make watering in my large garden easier, once you have these laid correctly that's all you do. I can run several at a time as they don't require much pressure. I lay them around the base of plants.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the typical style soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: These soaker hoses have more of a cloth feel than the typical plastic tube ones you normally see being used. The hoses get completely and evenly soaked from end to end. They are much more durable as well. The typical style of hose will snag and break at the joint or anywhere there is pressure. These stand up to being dragged around the corner of the house or wrapped around bushes.
customer_reviews.author: John Wiewel

customer_reviews.title: Less Then A Year Old, Large Leaks Formed
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hose for less then a year and it now has huge leaks in the center which flood the center plants and under water the futherest plants. Over priced look for other brands.
customer_reviews.author: James Bond

customer_reviews.title: Busted first time used!
customer_reviews.text: First time use it split and popped. Too expensive to use one time.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia W.

customer_reviews.title: WHO YOU CALLING A DRIP?
customer_reviews.text: For the consummate gardener. Together with newly acquired flexible hose, we got thus covered!
customer_reviews.author: EXCLUSIVE SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Great option to the rubber soakers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for raised bed vegetable garden. I garden organic and wanted safer water delivery system as opposed to the rubber soaker hoses that state unfit for drinking. These hoses seem very durable. I found if you run water through the hose full blast first then lower the pressure it was the easiest way to wrap around the plants. So far working great.
customer_reviews.author: Ardis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect perfect perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for our large garden! They “weep” water which is quicker (but without wasting water) for deeper watering! Thin and easily folded for storage! Wanted more but they are sadly no longer available!
customer_reviews.author: DRW

customer_reviews.title: not durable, can't patch them
customer_reviews.text: Like others have written - it only lasted one year. Once you get one pin hole it turns into a water spewing hole and the whole thing is toast. The plastic tubing inside the fabric is so flimsy it appears impossible to patch it with tape since it will not hold any shape and there is no way to cut it out and connect the two pieces. The old recycled rubber hoses would get holes after 5-15 years, and you can not only tape them since they hold their shape, there are connectors so you can remove a hole and connect the two pieces.
customer_reviews.author: T P in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Purchasing this a product is a gamble
customer_reviews.text: Worked twice and sprung a leak near spigot. Must reroute excess water away from foundation. Too bad, because my previous purchase works well. Listen to your fellow reviewers: buying this product is a roll of the dice.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie J

customer_reviews.title: Soak Away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous Soaker Hose!!! Defiantly will last especially with the lifetime warranty. This beats any soaker hose you can get at any of those box stores. Every year I was having to replace the other ones they sale. Its made of fabric and here in Texas it is a must to water your foundation. I 100% Recommend
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD L VANCE

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality not fitting a known brand name
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty terrible. It took a while to finish the gardens these were purchased for. Once we finished, we installed these and sprung a leak in about 5 minutes. Then another leak popped up..another...and another. They split at the seam and unfortunately it appears to be a bad design. To make matters worse, they kink at the slightest bend, leaving half our garden bone dry. The return period expired a week ago, so I'm pretty much stuck like Chuck. Honestly, I should have paid more attention or just gone to a store and gotten the trusty rubber variety.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great hose!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these hoses in different lengths. Have been using them for a couple of months and they are doing exactly what they are supposed to do with no problems encountered. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John Rob

customer_reviews.title: Soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: Thrde hoses work very well. It a little hard to maneuver in flower bed but it couldn't have any less maneuverability...
customer_reviews.author: Imaquilttin

customer_reviews.title: The hose splits at the seam.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this hose when I first received it. The pressure/ flow rate was good, the hose didn't kink, and it did a great job of watering evenly throughout my entire garden. However, after only a couple of months it began leaking horribly near the connector because it split at the seam. I would recommend going with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen O

customer_reviews.title: Given its collapsable nature, I find this hose hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Given its collapsable nature, I find this hose hard to work with as the washer pressure sometimes isn't enough to get around bends/kinks that form after the hose collapses down after use. You have to make very broad turns and hope that nothing bumps it.
customer_reviews.author: B. CAREY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Me
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I use it to soak my foundation. Is easy to use and maintain. Not even visible in my yard because of the low profile. It's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these last summer, 50ft, and felt very confident it was the right choice after seeing the ratings. Sadly, mine was utter garbage. Kinks, big leaks, falling apart, and was very uneven in its weeping when it did work. I didn't get more than a month of use out of it, and just threw it away in the end. I would like to see what the "old" version was like to have earned so much praise - because this one is not worth anyone's time or money.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I thought since I bought a 50 ft soaker hose with a splitter and another 20 ft on the other side it wouldn't reach the ends but I was wrong. These things are working perfectly for us.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ashe

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Kink. These soaker hoses are a pain. They kink easily. The only way they will work is in a straight line. One kinked and burst!
customer_reviews.author: idaho bridget

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: The weeper is pretty thin and perhaps too flexible. It has to be laid out perfectly flat with no kinks in order to have water fill the entire length. It also has a problem if laid out in a back and forth pattern on a slope. The water will drain rapidly to the lowest spots. If you buy this also buy a take up spool such as used for winding up electrical cord. The spool will allow you keep the hose free of knots and kinks during storage and deployment. Other ratings caution that it breaks easily and I can see why.
customer_reviews.author: Chipmunk

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Way better than trying to hand water. I got more strawberries off the vines once they were finally getting enough to drink.
customer_reviews.author: Nickola Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: The Gilmour soaker hose seems quite a bit sturdier than the Apex soil soaking hose, which lasted for about 3 months before squirrels discovered it and chewed large holes in multiple spots. I buried this soaker hose in hopes of avoiding this happening again, so hopefully the squirrels will not read this. The 50 foot hose seems to work well even with water pressure of 30-40 psi.
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I’d say don’t buy this piece of junk, but it looks like it has been discontinued by the manufacturer. Two months after l bought it it started leaking at the seams. Water pours out in a five foot section and floods everything while the rest of the hose barely gets damp. It’s useless. Move on.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: Soaker Hose
customer_reviews.text: Works so well had to buy another. Made of strong material.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: A hose for the season
customer_reviews.text: These soaker hoses were just the way they're supposed to. I also have a 25-footer. The difficulty is in laying out the hose so that there are no kinks in it. And that's a user issue, not a hose issue. Winding it around in the garden so that water flows in it freely isn't quite as easy as it sounds with the 50 foot length. It's much easier laying out the shorter hose; simply easier to manage. But, once it's in place, theoretically, you should be able to leave for the season. Theoretically.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package, went to install and this happened before I even got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Best soaker hose that I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Pressure at end of hose is same as at connection. Minimal leakage at connection.
customer_reviews.author: Anna M Gagye

customer_reviews.title: Best hose on the market bar none
customer_reviews.text: I love this water hose. It holds equal pressure, is very flexible and has shown excellent durability over the last year. Other soaker hoses have a tendency to rot in the summer heat or from the moisture they carry but this has not been a problem with the Gilmour. One very useful feature of a lay flat style hose is that if it is too long you can just tie a knot in it to shorten its length and instantly you are not wasting water. My reccomendation is to buy the longest hose you can afford!
customer_reviews.author: C.L. Mershon

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, coming apart at the seams and kinks
customer_reviews.text: Just got to use this hose. It kinks everywhere and the seams are coming apart. Very disappointed that I can't return it as I didn't keep the packaging
customer_reviews.author: Ld

customer_reviews.title: Great soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: Some soaker hoses are strong on one end and weak on others. This one is even throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Carole D. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Add extension chord spools for storage...
customer_reviews.text: amazing longevity whether under mulch or long the edge. The first generation was a bit more well constructed than this generation don't know if it will effect longevity though... ahhh but running over it with mower or edger... it isn't bullet proof to stupid! We roll them on on extension chord spools for easy put out and pick up...
customer_reviews.author: Innocent Bystander

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, leaky.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, leaky and will not seal at hose hookup.
customer_reviews.author: U. Schoenwald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, flexible with a cloth like covering that seeps water around it. Works very well. Will be ordering more for other garden spots
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Hose
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is great and I still use it. It works great and I am glad that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barth

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our use to water flower beds. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: saildog2009

customer_reviews.title: Beats Rubber
customer_reviews.text: These work a lot better than rubber soaker hoses, with more uniform water distribution and very few leaks. Used them all last summer and didn't notice any problems until right at the end of the season the 75 foot hose developed a couple of spots where the water sprayed instead of dripping . The shorter (50' and 25') hoses were great all the way through. My thought is to use shorter hoses for big areas and either end-to-end connect or use a hose splitter to even out the pressure over the length of the soaker hose.
customer_reviews.author: Star Surgeon

customer_reviews.title: flexible hose with holes from start to finish
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this item is that there are holes to release water from the hook-up all the way to the end. It will release water from start to finish which could be a problem if the ground is not completely flat or if the hose crosses a walkway. A mess was created when the water on the walkway made its way to the paver steps and pooled. It seems to take a while to water, as well. Only used it once, so I cannot comment on how durable this soaker will be.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat
customer_reviews.text: Great hose for the money. It’s light weight and easily storable. Water can leak through the fabric but not enough to impact water pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Chris87

customer_reviews.title: I don't like to over water the ground around the plants because ...
customer_reviews.text: Its getting the job done, i don't need to water the garden by hand anymore. I don't like to over water the ground around the plants because weeds tend to grow. Only fault is when i turn down the pressure at the valve so i don't get too much water soaking the plants. The end of the hose gets flatter and the hose doesnt drip equal amount of water, throughout the length of it. You get more water dripping neer the connection.
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: water distribution
customer_reviews.text: Water only comes out at the seams. Pictures imply that it comes out all around the hose material, but it just drips out at the seams. If sharp bend in hose, like right angle, water may pour our at a faster rate at the bend.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Low water usage, good coverage if you loop it every 8 inches.  Lasts maybe two seasons.
customer_reviews.text: Great for watering vegetable beds. Set a timer for some appropriate time, the you can relax
customer_reviews.author: rrbv

customer_reviews.title: Stopped dripping evenly.
customer_reviews.text: They worked well at first, but after a couple of months, one of them started to only drip at the far end for about a foot and a half. It left most of my in ground flower bed dry and a pool of water on my porch.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Drip Hose
customer_reviews.text: Best drip hose ever. Those hard weeping rubber hoses don’t last. They are stiff and inflexible and spring leaks that soot out. These are very flexible. You can get them just where needed. I now have four - one I bought three seasons ago and no problems. Great product
customer_reviews.author: VPT

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I expected. I thought this soaker hose would work well in a small garden around mani little plants , unfortunately you need to make long slow curves or else it will kink. I was also disappointed by the inconsistency of water output along the hose. Random sections of the garden get lots of water, and others barely get any water at all. Even though the hose was very cheap, I expected more from it.
customer_reviews.author: JSch

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from the neck
customer_reviews.text: after 7 months the water couldn't reach the end because to much was leaking out form the spout.
customer_reviews.author: The Hollisters

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Watering the garden has never been easier. I set one of these in each of our vegetable beds and connected them with "regular" hoses. Now all I do is connect the one hose to the tap and start the water running - the garden gets a slow trickle of water, actually using less water overall for the effect (as less is lost to evaporation with a trickle hose). Thumbs up, get one for every garden bed you have!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Rumpf

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying Soak
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is a bit different in that it is flat,that is,until you turn on the hose. Then it puffs up into a round hose and water begins to "weep" out. The material is a strong nylon type and after you shut it off, the hose can be easily rolled up, unlike a vinyl or rubber hose that can be stiff and unwieldy. I don't yet know about how long this hose will last, that remains to be seen but I like how it works right now.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie J. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used others on the market, they were very disappointing. This works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than rubber
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these, and will probably buy another one. They're much easier to lay out than the rubber ones I had previously. I purchased some landscape staples and just tacked it where I needed it. It seems to wet the soil adequately, but I will cover it with straw mulch once the veggies are up to keep the water from evaporating further. If it stands the test of time, it will be one of my favorite new products for the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi H.

product_meta.title: Gilmour Flat Weeper Soaker Hose, 50 feet, Black (870501-1001)
product_meta.description: Size:50 feetThis flexible soaker hose gets water right where you want it: at the roots. Water seeps out of all sides of the fabric jacket and directly into the soil, for waste-free watering in garden beds and other tight spaces. Flat design makes it a breeze to roll up and store it for next season.
feature_bullets: Snake through rows of new seedlings or under mature plantings for efficient, deep watering season after season
Create an easy DIY watering system by burying the hose under mulch. Hook it up to a timer and enjoy healthy, vibrant plants without all the watering work
Clog-resistant fabric cover for consistent soaking

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars780 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
